country.name: Nigeria
country.overview: Nigeria, an African country on the Gulf of Guinea, has many natural landmarks and wildlife reserves. Protected areas such as Cross River National Park and Yankari National Park have waterfalls, dense rainforest, savanna and rare primate habitats. One of the most recognizable sites is Zuma Rock, a 725m-tall monolith outside the capital of Abuja that’s pictured on the national currency.

translations.name: ประเทศไนจีเรีย

geography.location_description: Western Africa, bordering the Gulf of Guinea, between Benin and Cameroon
geography.area_note: about six times the size of Georgia; slightly more than twice the size of California
geography.climate: varies; equatorial in south, tropical in center, arid in north
geography.terrain: southern lowlands merge into central hills and plateaus; mountains in southeast, plains in north
geography.notes: the Niger River enters the country in the northwest and flows southward through tropical rain forests and swamps to its delta in the Gulf of Guinea
